title: Steven Gerrard reveals the most vain footballers he's ever played with - and it's bad news for Jamie Carragher
text:

Steven Gerrard has revealed the most vain footballers he's ever played with - and it's bad news for best mate Jamie Carragher. 
As part of NIVEA 's deal with the Reds, the sponsor interviewed a few of Liverpool's legends prior to their game against their Real Madrid counterparts. 
Liverpool ended up winning the encounter 4-3. 
The former Anfield heroes included Steven Gerrard, Michael Owen and Steve McManaman. 
The first question they asked Liverpool's legends was, 'Who is the most vain footballer you have ever played with?'. "You cheeky..." (Photo: Zak Kaczmarek - Liverpool FC/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
Gerrard responded with: "Jean Arne Riise. But I've noticed Carra's started wearing wax on Sky Sports so he might take that mantle." 
McManaman and Owen, who both played at Real Madrid, agreed on Guti. "I'm so pretty." (Photo: Getty Images Sport) 
McManaman said: "Certainly would have been Guti. He was never out of the mirror." 
Owen added: "Oh, Guti. Definitely him. He had a mirror right next to his space in the dressing room." Steven Gerrard spills the beans (Photo: Nivea Men) 
When the question of 'Who is the least vain footballer you've ever played with' came round, Gerrard hadn't finished ribbing Carragher. 
He said Carragher used to be the least vain footballer he's ever played with but added: "Since he's gone into the showbiz world I've noticed he's taken a few grey hairs out and added a bit of wax to that basic carpet he's wearing."
